review: Nothing fancy, but it gets the job done. And I always think having the managers bring out the food is a nice touch, it says "we care".  Food was mediocre. I hate when I order a rice bowl and they clearly use uncle bens instant rice, but again... We were hungry and the food was decent enough. Better than fast food anyway.
Went out for lunch as a family before a wedding.  Lemon waters, excellent food and great service.  My daughter loves Chilis and ordered spinach queso dip and loved it.  Definitely will go back!
The bartender is not good.  He's more interested with what is on tv and the employees hanging out at the bar than he is of the paying patron.

The steak I ordered was disgusting.  The only good thing about this place was the waiter did a good job and was always around filling up water.  Which I need lots of to get through my leather shoe of a steak.

Total disappointment! I was in Regina for a couple of days staying nearby at the Holiday Inn. One night I walked over to Chili's for a bellini. Last time I was in town and ate here I had one that was amazing. Not tonight. They changed their recipe and now it's a bland peach not slushy drink and had no sangria in it. So I asked for a frozen raspberry margarita. Even worse! It had this big black gob in it and when I asked what the hell it was, waitress said it's vanilla bean. WTF?? Who puts vanilla in their margarita? Chili's that's who. So she made me one without vanilla. I couldn't drink it because it was so sweet, just like syrup. I told the waitress this was a complete disaster and I didn't want any of these awful drinks. Left thirsty.
Great service and food. You may have to wait up to 40 minutes for a seat during prime time for groups, but plenty of seats for 2.
Not impressed.  I figured being a chain it would be similar to the Chili's we love down South but not at all the same.
